column4: hey i have a toshiba satellite and i cant get touchpad drivers help!
which satellite?
does it work any?
c655d-s5126 yes it works it just is not recognizing it as a touchpad
just because hardware is recognised as something doesn't mean it will work
???what???
all your hardware will tell you what it is, doesn't mean its going to run as expected
i know that.... i cant find a hardware list where i might be able to fix this
can you expand the question please
in windows there is a hardware manager  i am running ubuntu 10.10 and i remember i found something similar in 9.04 i think
bottom line my mouse is recognized as a regular mouse not a touchpad
ok, let me search, see what toshes need to make touchpads work
thank you
press Fn+F9   does it now work...
your system probably has a shortcut combo to disable touchpad, press it
its in the mouse options, search in dash
found the boot option:  acpi=ht   which may help too
or try the boot option: acpi=copy_dsdt
is there a way i can tell it that it is not a logitech ps2 mouse but really a touchpad?
Ive seen this a few times, if you formulate an xorg.conf you can explicitly tell it
uhhhh hmm still kinda a noob here
searching will show you examples
make a script to unload or load the driver module depending on if its already loaded, then have the script run when you press a shortcut using CCSM
WOW  um huh
